title: CITY STEETS THROUGH GRIDLOCK ALERT
title_page: CITY STEETS THROUGH GRIDLOCK ALERT - The New York Times
maintext:
SUZANNE DALEY
At the command center - a brown van parked at 49th Street and Rockefeller Center - three city traffic agents listened to radios, keeping a ledger of the reports coming in.
''There's a tractor-trailer blocking two lanes at 39th and 10th Avenue,'' an agent at the scene called in. ''He says he has the Commissioner's permission.''
In the back seat of the van, beside a map of midtown Manhattan titled ''Gridlock Alert Day,'' the head of the Bureau of Traffic Operations, Samuel I. Schwartz, looked up from his clipboard.
''No, he doesn't,'' he said.
''That is a negative,'' the traffic agent manning the radio answered. ''You are to move that vehicle. Copy?'' One of the Worst Days
